Text: ditto, subs don't work. They're the wrong format: sfv instead of srt
this file for English subs is working fine for me: http://www.allsubs.org//subs-download/thirst-2009-bestdivx/1179058/
sfv is not a sub format, it's for software that checks your download against a record of the original file.
That said, there is something wrong with the sub files in the archives.  The link sharpsponge posted works, though.
